text: Bottle. Pours medium caramel amber with a medium white foam residing. Scent is light floral notes. Honey. Taste is dense weizen with a thick palate of caramel malt and some bitterness. Honey. Herbs. Finish is smooth and drinkable. Great.
Bottle at polyhistor. Hazy yellow colour small white lacing. Nose is wheat, and some spicy phenoly notes. Taste is low bitterness low sourness.A decent wheat ale cant really feel the flowers.

Hazy amber. Strong aroma, with citrusy and spicy hops. Lightly sweet taste, with a strong hoppy flavour, some spice and some wheat. Powerful bitter finish. Medium body, and a smooth mouthfeel. Overall, a great wheat IPA. It has just enough sweetness to balance the powerful hops. I did not notice up any of the flowers or leaves, though. Tasty and smooth.
14-05-17 // draft at Alus Celle, Riga. Light hazy orange, small white head. Hoppy nose. Taste is light bodied, medium sweet, quite IPA-like. Fresh hops with citrus and floral notes. Medium bitter.
Viel IPA Hoppyness, ein knackiger Malzkorpus und nice Limettenspice lassen es krachen. Von Flower Power keine Spur, macht nichts. Geil!!! 0,33l CAN von BEYOND BEER HH.
On keg at muted horn. Pours cloudy amber. Nose of flowers, honey, grass, resin, light biscuits. Taste is hay, fruit, flowers, summer in a beer.
On tap. Golden color, hazy liquid, white head. Aroma of pale ale, not spotting those fancy ingredients very much. Easily drinkable, but nothing special for me.
On tap at Ølfestivalen. Cloudy golden with a lasting white head. Fruity hoppy aroma with a touch of malt. Sweetish fruity flavour with a medium bitter finish
Light orange hazy with medium white head. Nice fruity aroma. Not typical for wheat beer strong bitterness, but very nice and fruity. Lasting bitter aftertaste.

Tap at BrewDog Tallinn. Hazy orange colour, bright white head small head. Flowery, citrussy, banana, mango, sweet aroma. Taste is crisp, sweet, lemony, medium hoppy, grassy. Long bitterish lemon peel aftertaste. Medium bodied, lively carbo. Good refresher!

On tap at Brewdog Tallinn. Pours hazy dark yellow colour. Moderate white head disappears quite quickly. Sweetness, toffee, flowery notes, hints of citrusses, fruits in the aroma. Slightly caramelly, bit sweet, citrussy beginning. Spices, toffee in the middle. Malty, bit flowery, citrussy finish. Rather light bodied, moderately carbonated, quite good brew.

Tap at Erzbierschof Krone. Pours lightly cloudy amber. Aroma is spices, lightly herbal, minerals, elderflower. Lots of that on the tongue too, with a medium body and a lively carbonation. Almost fruity. Rather sweet palate, still fruity. Good!

Can from Westhill service station. Pours a hazed orange with a thick white foam head that lasts. Aromas of orange zest, a bouquet of flowers and cut grass. Flavour is juicy grapefruit and lime with orange pith and unripe mango. Delicious

F: medium size, white, average retention.
C: gold, hazy.
A: malty, wheat, tangerine, grapefruit, mango, caramel.
T: malt, caramel, grapefruit, tangerine, wheat, very fresh fruity, medium to full body, medium carbonation, very good, enjoyed. Sampled from tap @ Salon Piva in Bratislava.

Can, pours a hazy golden with medium white head. Lots of Rose and other flowers coming through in the flavor along with some fruit, cardboard, and delicate spices. Nice bitterness from the hops but too much astringent cRdboard in the end.

Can from Inn At Home, Guildford. Floral, herbs, leaves - a more flowery wheat beer aroma. An opaque amber. Fluffy white head. Initially a light bitter/umami before building in bitterness. Citrus through to strong grapefruit. Herby. Medium bodied. Slightly oily. A little bite from the lively carbonationarbonation. Long dry finish. Good stuff, especially having taken the pram (and baby) around the block.

Can from Redmonds of Dennistoun. Aroma faint citrus, grass, lots of floral stuff, even a bit of jasmine. Bit of wheat to the taste, countered by lots of hops and floral at the roof of the mouth. Cracker.

Can from Beergiumk
Floral intense hoppy aroma with some citric scents over wheat aromas. Taste is again floral, wheaty and herbal with small zesty bitterness.
Nice floral aroma. Light pineapple taste with elements of ginger and some herbs. Prickly texture.

Bottle @ van Moll, 5 cl sample. Slight hazy golden color, short frothy head. Aroma is very flowery, some grainy wheat. Soft bitterness, some flowery and herbal note, though still easy drinkable. Good flowery blonde beer, well made.
Bottle @ Van Moll Brewpub shared with Caesar. Orangy color, average sized off-white head. Smell and taste wheat, lightly hops, a bit fruity, moderately bitter. Decent body, a bit fizzy carbonation.

Aroma: hints of flowers, some pleasant esters. Taste is mostly hops, some orange peel, hint of lemon, lime. No malt taste, no alcohol taste. Light sweet, medium bitter. Aftertaste doesnt last long. Overall drinkable beer and pretty good.
Bottle shared with friends. Pours light cloudy and smells like a bouquet of flowers. beautiful.

Huge thanks Matej J. for sharing this with us! Poured a misty golden-amber body with a big white head. Flowery aroma, rose, on wheaty malty background, quite fruity as well. Er, definitely smells like the sum of its parts, and that sum is awesome! Peachy, sweetish fresh flowery taste, herbal, well executed body though a bit on the light side. Cant see myself ordering two perhaps, but I can see myself ordering one here and there and definitely recommending it to people, especially those not very well versed in beer. Another great creation from this brewery!
Bottle from Systembolaget. Fruity and hoppy smell with some citrus, peach and tropical fruits. Nice and refreshing. Easy to drink.

Botella 33 cl en el Lupulo Junio 2014. (r209). Fcpref 19..02..2016. Color amarillento turbio con espuma blanca Aromas y sabores maltosos y cereales algo dulces y florales convtoques suaves amargos. Cuerpo ligero a medio Con 6.3 vol y Bastante sabor. Bastante buena suave y refrescante. Para repetir.
Bottle shared. Hazy orange with a tall white head. Notes of flowery, perfumey hops, citrus, wheat, yeast, soft spices. Medium to light body, low carbonation and a hoppy and floral finish.
backlog. Orange looking with a white head. Aroma is spicy, flowery, hint of lemonzest and slight dill. Medium bodied. Nice for the style

Blind tasting from a bottle. Mild tropical fruits, camomile flowers, other undisclosed flowers. Light wheat. Lots going on in the nose. Carbonation level is good and gives a soft mouthfeel. Shows a medium body. 
Good balance between the ingredients. This is pretty good and when I found it was a wheat ale, I was more impressed.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2016 Naranjita amarillenta, con buena capa de espuma. Muy aromática. Muy floral. Carbonatación presente (sobre todo en boca). Se nota la concentración de lúpulos tanto en sabor como en aroma. Su sabor me recuerda más a una IPA que a una cerveza típica de trigo. Compleja pero disfrutable.

Almost clear orange of color with an white head. An aroma of citrus, lemon, exotic fruits, hops and weak sweet peach. A flavor of hops, peach, mango, hops, pineapple, hay and fresh cutted grass.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Bottle 330 ml. Aroma: floral, perfume, fruity. Taste: citrus, fruity, a bit sweet, wheat, good and refreshing drink.
Tap at dobre časy. Hazy golden colour with stable head off. Aroma of herbs, fruits, flowers. Taste of grapefruits, lemon,herbs. Hoppy bitter finish. Nice
Bottle from Kihoskh. Hazy golden pour with a fluffy head. Notes of grains, citrus, light hoppy with some floral notes.

Bionda, limpida, bella schiuma bianca frizzantina. Aroma floreale, erbaceo. Piacevole la bevuta, molto fresca e leggera. Fiori, erbe, lievito in grande evidenza. Finale ancora floreale. Davvero primaverile.

Bottle at home. Pours a cloudy orange color with a creamy big beige head. Fruity aroma of grapefruit, orange peel, pine, flowers, white bread and lime. The flavour is also fruity with more grapefruit, pine, soap, orange juice and grassy hops in the end. Has a slick mouth feel, medium body and a balanced bitterness. Fresh, fruity and hoppy ale. Well balanced.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of citrus, floral notes, flower leaves which gives it a slight perfumed touch. Also some bread, grapefruit and orange. The taste is bitter with notes of bread, grapefruit, lemon, lemon peel, weak malt, pine and quite juicy. Floral notes are more subtle here. Nice.

Yellow to orange, opaque, moderate sticky head. Nice fresh aroma of tropical fruit, nectar, a bit earthy. Light to medium body. Medium bitter taste, bonedry, fruity, hoppy. Good-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: cloudy golden blond beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: hoppy, grassy and floral. Sweet notes. Taste: medium body with floral attack, sweet notes. Hoppy finish. Easy drinkable, perfect beer for spring. Sweet finish. Aftertaste: sweet wet bitterness.

Bottle enjoyed at home
Orange hazy, big frothy white head. Smell of fruity yeast esters, wheat, hay, malts. Moderate sweet, alot of spicy flavors, pepper, herbs, complex stuff which the aroma tells nothing about! Medium bitter, resin tail. Very nice!

Bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen - golden orange pour with puffy white head. Aroma and taste is fruity and light wheaty, light pale malt, some nice citrus fruity notes, great delicate floral hoppy action into the finish, tasty easy going brew.

was bit a disappointment. Some wheat, caramel, quite intense hop kick, floral, bit citrusy, orange peel, light pine. Light sweetness with light bitterness. Boring quite dry finish.
Rather I drink good IPA or good wheat. This one is in the middle of them, but not working well for me.
Bottle 0.33l at Majstor za pivo Belgrade Serbia.Taste with Ogi and Vlada.29.12.2015.Pour it hazy yellow color with medium white head.Aroma floral.Taste of some flowers,smooth,spice yeasty finish.

Gran cerveza, a pesar de su estilo, que no es santo de mi devoción, me parece un gran producto pero esto no es nuevo para mí viniendo de la casa To Øl que siempre hace cervezas a la altura de sus etiquetas. Espectáculo.

Bottle. Amber. Strong citrus hop aroma, flowers and some malt, not unlike an APA. Touch wheat sourness, typical wheat yeasts. Refreshing but a typical hybrid that doesn't quite deliver on either front 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Lensemble confère un coté très fleuri à cette bière. Alors bien sur, il faudra être un expert pour pouvoir identifier séparément chacun des parfums de fleurs (personnellement je nai eu que la rose et lhibiscus), mais limpression générale est agréable.

Le nez est demblée particulièrement fleuri: on sent du parfum de rose, et aussi beaucoup le présence du houblon, à travers des fleurs et de fruits tropicaux.

Dans la bouche, le corps est assez léger, leffervescence assez marquée. Le blé procure des notes un peu piquantes, légèrement acides. Les arômes sont la aussi très floraux: rose, hibiscus, et les autres fleurs, que certains pourront peut être distinguer. Grosse présence houblonnée avec des fruits et du bonbon acidulé. Parfois la fleur est tellement présente quon frole le désodorisant en bombe, mais cette impression est restée rare. Le blé est également la.

La finale est plus amère, bien balancée par les fleurs.

Bottle at Draft House Hammersmith. Cloudy orange with white head. Lightly sweetish malty taste and aroma with citrus, and mango. Quite light but still quite a lot of flavor. Slightly dry citrus finish.
Bottled:Hazy orange color with a mid sized head. Aroma is hops, grass, marsh mallows, tobacco and flowers. Taste is hops, bubble gum, grass and citrus. Dry, floral finish.

6.3%ABV.  Wheat Ale.

Tapped out a gold Amber. 10ºSRM.

Nose has sweet milk and is remiscent of the pink milk left behind after you munch the crunch berries.  Its sweet, but has a nice lactic depth to give it some body.  Otherwise there are sweet ripe fruit aromas of apricots.  Interesting note is that out of the bottle you get a lot more citrus brightness in the nose with yellow grapefruit and oranges.

Mouthfeel is soapy.  There are pale malt flavors of malt shakes, pale wheat toast, cookie dough and raw peanuts.  Overall a  palate that rides very sweet.   This brew also boasts a full-bodied malt palate with nothing beery or lager-like.    Hops have a pleasant spiciness, being closest to Thai basil, which is sweet and spicy. 

Finish is abbreviated and clean.

A good effort.  Makes it to the list.

Goes on Favorites List!
Bottle at home. Pours hazy gold with tight white head. Not as floral an aroma as the name might suggest, but very pleasant. Nice balance of hops/wheat/berries/flowers/grass. Really interesting.

Bottle sample at a tasting at the new LiBira brewpub. Thanks eyes_wide_shut & YK23. Golden with a white head. Aroma of stale hops, floral notes. Rather dry flavor, with flowers, and overripe fruity hops, mildly stale. Medium-bodied. Could be fresher, but still OK.

Bottle. Cloudy amber body with nice white head Aroma is floral fruity. Taste is malts with citrus, floral notes and herbs. Aftertaste is nice balanced between hop bitterness and malt sweetness. Nice one.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2016 Čapované v Beer Time Nitra. Krásna kvetinovo citrusová aróma...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
appear pale with a fine white head very floral aroma with hints of citrus. taste light bitter, well carbonated good mouthfeel, but no wow effect.

0,33 bottle in Belgrade-Serbia. Cloudy pale golden color, a bit dark. Frothy white foam. Nose: hops blast, USA kind of! A bit orangey, also pine resin and a creamy unexpected note. Nice. Mouth: gassy, wheat, a bit peppery, elegant grassy finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Aroma and taste of citrus and flowers with notes of pine needles. Medium body and carbonation. Texture is watery to juicy. Slightly dry and bitter finish. I like the speciality of the flowers.
Tap. Golden hazy colour with big thick white head. Aroma contains hops, mango and bit similarity with air freshener. Easy to drink, not too intensive. Well done!

Piwo złote, mocno zamglone. 
Piana drobna, kremowa, obfita.
W aromacie amerykański chmiel. Trochę goryczki, owoce cytrusowe, mango. 
W smaku wytrawne, lekkie nuty pszeniczne. Wyczuwalny dodatek kwiatów, jakby lekka róża.
Bardzo przyjemna wariacja.

the aroma is malty and floral with shades of honey, flowers, citrus, spicy grasses and pine... the taste is malty and spicy with notes of pine needles, bitter almond, dried fruits, grapefruit and spicy herbs... the aftertaste is sweet, bitter and dry...
KRS 220515. Golden-orange colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, malt, wheat, berries. Flavour is fruit, malt, wheat, berries, flower, citrus, pine. Medium body. Nice beer.
Gylden brun klar med fingerhøyt hvitt skum. Humlepreget lukt, fersken, ananas og blomster. Middels fylde syrlig bitter smak, sitrusskall, noe moden ananas og druesten. Kort lett bitter avsluttning

Bottle at guirigall palma. Cloudy yellow smooth white head.aroma is mild yeasty and hoppy. I would not guess wheat though. Flavor is very refreshingly dry hoppy but not at all wheaty. Still very tasty and quenching. Some notes of caramel.
33 cl. bottle. Hazy amber colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, wheat, citrus, grass and with a bitter finish.
Hazy pale orange with fluffy white head. Lots of hops and some floral undertones and a dry finish.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy orange-hued straw yellow body with a huge rocky white head. Nose is wheat, straw, hay, pine, tropical fruits, floral herbal notes and hints of melon and spruce. Taste is complex spicy herbal flower notes with wheat, pale malts, straw, wet grass and hints of caramel and red fruits. Medium to full body, high carbonation. A nice spring tribute with lots of flavor and quite a bit of innovativeness to boot. Fresh and drinkable.
Opaque light gold, strong white head. True meadow aroma, with some hoppy notes. LIghtly bitter, light bodied, lovely herb undertones. Finishes a bit dry and bitter. Lovely!

Bottle
Aroma-fruits, bread
Appearance-pale, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Floral aroma. Hazy golden color. Sweet start, but quickly becomes alcoholic and bitter, almost too bitter. The additions of fhe flowers give this a complex flavor, but not necessarily nice. The wheat smooths it out though. Its nice for just one. The label is great.

Barwa zlota, opalizujaca, obfita sredniopecherzykowa piana. Aromat cytrusowo-pszeniczny z nutami kwiatowymi. Smak gladki pszeniczny, wylazi alkoholowosc ale pije bardzo cieple wiec ciezko powiedziec jak to jest. Jest tez dosc dluga, wyrazna, cytrusowa goryczka.
How : bottle Appearance : cloudy yellow, medium to small white head. Aroma: intense floral, grass, pear, hint of citrus.

14.07.2015, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice slightly bubbly-creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry floral, weeds, flowers, minerals, lawn, leafs, hay, hops, cereal, hints of dried fruits and sulfur. Taste is dry floral, weeds, grain, minerals, flowers, alcohol, paper, hay, leafs, cereal, bark, grass. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly dry and harsh mouthfeel, fizzy carbonation. Not my cup of tea.

Bottle in the Marketplace Ale House, Doncaster. Hazy golden with a little off white froth. Not a huge amount of aroma. Some light citrus. The taste is citrus, hay, moderate spice and bread. Tasty and refreshing.
Pours cloudy orange with white head. Aroma is floral, herbal and hoppy. Flavour is more tame. It is floral, malty, light to medium bitter and perfume.
Bottle from Theatre of Wine, Blackheath. Hazy amber pour with a white head. Tropical fruit and tangerine aroma. Sweet fruit flavours. Quite a refreshing number. Nice.

330ml bottle. Great artwork as usual. Lovely floral aroma. Quite a sharp flavour, lightly fruity with bitterness in check. Expected more from the flowers used but all in all a marvellous summery beer.

Bottle from Wine Emporium, Newstead, 240515. Wow - its like drinking a glass of fresh cut flowers. Strong pungent flower aroma, one of the more unusually aromatic beers I have had. The flavour follows suit is is all about the floraliness as well.
From bottle at Søstrene Karlsen bar & kjøkken. Hazy golden. Persistent off-white head and lacing. Flowerfields, elderberries, American hops and succade in aroma and taste. A bit fizzy.

Light opalescent golden with a fine poring frothy white head with good lacings. tropical fruits like mango, passion fruit and orange dominate up front yet subtle aromas of caramel, wheat, green leafs, floral and flowery such as roses and camomille develop on the nose, basically a summer meadow. Light lively with a soft bit slick texture and a medium body. Some malt sweetness with a well balanced fruity bitterness with floral impressions on the palate. Medium finish.

Bottle 0,33l at Gamle Major, Oslo. Pours hazy orange colour with white firm head. Aroma is earthy, hoppy, sweet notes, honey, malty. Taste is medium bitter, with some caramel notes, dry, resin. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ambar, bonita espuma, abundante y muy duradera. Espectacular aroma, lupulado, muy floral (no sólo los lúpulos sino las flores que lleva añadidas en la receta) Y frutas tropicales. En boca pasa completamente por APA o incluso american IPA. Desde luego es puro estilo americano. Realmente el trigo no se percibe por ningun lado. Es una explosión lupulada con un final muy amargo. Mucho de flor, mucho de fruta tropical. Mucho de amargor. Merece ser probada.
Bottle. Pours golden with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, wheat, some floral notes and citrus. Flavor is sweet and floral with some malt, citrus and wheat. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle. A hazy, orange-golden colored beer with a small, off-white head. Flowery, citrusy aroma with a touch of malts. The flavor has a nice bitterness to go along with the citrusy, flowery flavors known from the aroma. Some pale malts too. Medium body and a soft carbonation level. Lasting bitter, fruity and flowery finish with some bready malts. A bit weird maltyness in this one, but quite quenching anyway. 150522

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours hazy golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, citrus, grape and mango. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long fruity finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle thanks to LukasMH. Pours a hazy yellow with a big, white head. Aroma is extremely floral and hoppy. Roses, anis, slight lavender. Taste is very dry and floral, slight wheat sweetness that also provides a smooth body. High carbonation.
Orange, little cloudy, white head. Aroma: citrus, flowers Taste: light sour, medium bitterness Overall: expected more from this beer.
Bottle. Frothy White good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Light malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate buitter very herbal flavor. Average mdoerate bitter finish. Oily palate. Slightly boring.

Bottle from SlackerMads during European Swap 2/15, many thanks. Hazy yellow to light orange color, white head. aroma with wheaty character but mainly hop aroma (pine, grapefruit) and flowers. Flavor with lots of hops, grapefruit, peach, mango, flowers. Wheat character is not very intensive but overall a very drinkable, complex brew.

Bottle. Cloudy pale Yellow with a foamy White head. Wheaty aroma with plenty of fresh citrus. Orange, blossom. Its hop forward with a sparing bitterness. I really love a hoppy Wheat ale. On a blazing hot day, this hit the spot.

Bottle. Hazy orange, white stable head. In aroma flowers, herbals and some hoppiness at the end. In taste sweet malty and fruity with medium bitter finish to balance it all. In palate its medium and crisp. Great American wheat, one more great beer from To Øl.

My first gypsy beer ever tasted and I wont forget it. Pours a hazy orange with two finger white head. The smell is tickling the nose from the first drop poured in the glass. The aroma is a tribute to spring, full of flower with roses os first, followed by herbal and fruity notes. Taste is sweet, a bit fruity in the beginning but ends with beautiful refreshing hops. Palate is medium, crispy and long due to 40% of wheat.
Overall: Wonderful refreshing American Wheat Ale from To Øl. This is a perfect beer to enjoy on a spring picnic.
Cloudy orangy/yellow beer, sticky head. Nice and refreshing spring beer - a decent punch of hops, some floral notes. Quite dry, and very drinkable without being over the top.
Bottle. Golden pour, big white head. Aroma of citrus, grass and flowers. Freshly bitter taste of citrus, bitter peach, creamy wheat and flowers. Very drinkable.
Pours hazy orange with white firm head.Aroma is earthy, hoppy, sweet notes, honey, malty. Taste is medium bitter, with some caramel notes, dry, resin.Medium body. Medium carbonisation. Good beer.

Bottled. Pours hazy deep golden with an average off-white head. Aroma of yeast, citrus, herbs and caramel. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and bitter. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carbonation. A nice hoppy wheat.
The head is ok, the body blond. It smells fruity, citrus. Taste citrus, refreshing, fruity. Ok, easy going.

A hazy orange body covered by a fluffy white head that leaves lacing as it settles. Nose is quite sweet and floral with some rapeseed and resin notes as well. Taste is fairly sweet but some bitterness comes through on the finish. Lively carbonation with large bubbles and fairly rich mouthfeel. Quite nice wheat/pale ale hybrid.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2015 Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with one finger frothy white head. Aroma is quite hoppy. Citrus, grapefruit, citrus, pine, spicy flowers, grapes and only subtle wheat. Taste is moderate sweet, grapefruit, citrus peel and quite spicy and aromatic. Pine. Smooth wheat body and spicy dry finish with really citrusy hops.

Bottled 330ml. -from Svijet Piva Zagreb. Hazy yellow/golden coloured, small white head, fruity and light yeasty nose. Sweetish malty, flowery hoppy, mild yeasty and fruity with citrusy notes in rather dry bitter finish. Pretty high carbonation.

Aroma: weird nose, old, unwashed clothes, bread and grain malts, some wheat. Appearance: hazy, pale gold, medium, creamy, white head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: lively carbonation, turning lightly bitter, citrus fruits, some straw and grain malt. Overall: odd aroma, that is not the best example of this nice beer style. Bottle at Dukes Brew & Que, Haggerston.

blid sødlig blomster frugt artig duft. 
smag: citrus lime appelsin malt fylde. sødme. krideret eftersmag, en smule pepper eftersmag,
Draft. Pours a hazy amberish orange color. Aroma and taste are citrus with some bitterness.

Golden yellow color with big head that stays stable. Hoppy aroma with its associated fruitiness. Flowery aroma as well. Taste is fruity-hoppy, the flowers match perfectly, and a nice light Weizen mouthfeel. A really good beer. This fits my taste very well!

Hazy golden with a small white head. Quite heavy carbonation, medium bitter and medium sweet... not as complex as the brewers description led me to hope. Slightly fruity, but couldnt really pick out the herb and flower flavours. Easy to drink.

Lot of floral, citrus & herbs. Golden and hazy like in typical wheat beer, although minimal head. Complex taste of light sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, a bit fizzy. Finish is bitter and astringent but disappears fast. This was really nice wheat beer, I liked this a lot.

330 ml. bottle @ home. Procured from Caigny in Essen. BBF 13/02/2017. Poured into wine / beer hybrid glass. Darker very hazy apricot orange. Lightly off-white head, big collapsing bubbles. Nose is typical De Proef, this time around a tad too sweet, tad too yeasty, light moldy bread, mineral, faint metal. Taste is mineral slightly sweet dough, lots of yeast, odd sweetness (flowers?), lots of it, mineral, dried orange peel. Yeasty body, light mineral water feel. I expected a lot more from this one, unfortunate.

Buona, come una IPA poco amara, leggera. Pensavo di ritrovare qualcosa di più a proposito dei fiori.
Sippatica letichetta.

330 mml bottle tasted on the 04/11/2014. Cloudy and light orange/amber colour with a tan white head. Intense floral aroma with notes of citrus too. Taste is sweet, floral, wheaty and kind of spicy. Medium body and average carbonation. Little spicy aftertaste. Next one please!

Aus der Flasche, Gold gelb, leicht trüb, wenig schaum, fruchtig Hopfen in der Nase, frisch im Antrunk, Gefolgt von leichten Hefe Aromen, mit fruchtig hopfigen Abgang, Geschmack hält sich aber nicht so lange, trotzdem schön erfrischendes Weißbier, leider schmeckt man die Blüten nicht so raus

Slightly hazy beer and small head. Aroma of citrus and tangerine. Taste is tangerine, yeast, citrus and sherbet. Decent.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Beautiful cloudy amber color, big white head. Aroma is flowery, pineapple, pine. Medium body, average carbonation. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Surprisingly bitter, actually. Finish is short, and kinda empty, but very dry. Very interesting.
Bottle brewdog Sheff. Floral citrus aroma taste is same some sour decent bitterness. Decent stuff.
Bottle at Brewdog Sheffield; hazy amber pour with a frothy white head, floral aroma, taste has lemon orange, rich tea biscuit, citrus.

Very gassy ale light misty gold pour aromas floral fruit grain herbal spice yeast the flavours floral rose citrus lemon wheat smoothness pepper note spice yeast strain clove grapefruit nice going down good beer the finish best tastes floral spice fruit nice smooth sweet ale

Suitable light malt gives a good platform for the fruity, pine & floral hops with a silk mouthfeel. The hoppiness is not overpowering but also not deep. A pleasant drinkable beer.

Rated by BrewTom

Bottle. Cloudy orange body with a thin whitish head. Aroma of tangerine, grapefruit flowers, herbs, mild spicy. Taste is flowery, sweet wheat, bitter from hops and herbs, citric finish with grapefruit and lemon. Dry and refreshing, if youre going down this line be sure to wear some flowers in your beer.

330ml bottle. Pours a hazy deep gold, with a huge white head, which lasts very well and leaves good lacing. Subtly sweet floral notes, citrus hops and grainy wheat make up the aroma. Quite strong citrus and spice hops up front give way to grainy, lightly sweet wheat in the mid-palate. The floral flavours come through nicely in the finish. Wheat ales are normally not amongst my favourite beers, but this is an excellent piece of brewing. The floral ingredients complement the hops flavours and the light crispness of wheat very well, creating a flavoursome, highly refreshing and nicely restrained beer.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours light amber, nose is floral, taste is light and flowery.

@ Cerveteca Lisboa on 13th August 14; nose very much that of citra hops and grassier notes; taste is nicely layered with bitter orange marmelade, passion fruit and citrus components accompanied by a dry, subtle, lasting bitterness towards the finish.
On tap at Hack & Hop Fleet Street. Ok floral strong blond ale. Good hops good flowers. Aroma is a little syrupy blond. Flavour wise its pretty good. Ok strong golden flowery beer.
33cl bottle. Medium white head diminshing. Hazy tea beer color. Aroma is rose leaves, strawberries, flower meadow. Taste is corn, flower. Seems perfumed, but its quite thorough.

Butelka 33cl.
OCZY : piwo jest dosyć przejrzyste o bardzo delikatnym zamgleniu. Kolor piwa to jasna miedziana żółć. Piana ma grube pęcherze i szybko opada, ma kolor biały. 

NOS : aromat piwa jest bogaty ale wstydliwy i trzeba trochę nim potrząsnąć by ukazał wyraźne nuty cytrusów i kwiatów. Ogólnie zapach piwa przypomina chleb, tarte, miód akacjowy, mandarynki, mango, marakuja, jałowiec i zioła. 

USTA ; piwo jest średnio gazowane ale żywe i puszyste. 
Piwo ma świetnie wyważoną słodkość i gorzkość. Nuty słodowe podobne do tarty. Subtelnie cierpkie o nutach cytrusów i marakui. Gorzkość jest średnia i przypomina skórkę grejpfruta. Gorzkość nie zalega i nawet w posmaku przenika delikatna słodycz. 

ODCZUCIA : bez wad. Smaczne i łatwe w piciu. Trochę mydlane i ten smak trochę zalega łyk po łyku i jestem ciekaw ile szklanek byłoby trzeba by mnie zemdliło. 

OCENA : 
smak : 6/10
pijalność : 7/10
styl : +1
Практич& соверше& Хочется пить носом. Нюхать и наслажд& При этом вкус мужской, сильный и сухой.
Color dorado turbio con espuma blanca jabonosa. Aromas lupulados cítricos y herbales. Cuerpo ligero, fresca, sabor intensamente cítrico con toques herbales. El final tiene un amargor moderado. Bien.

Hazy golden color, medium sized white head. Medium body, fizzy carbonation. Extremely carbonated. Id say this is something between pale ale and wheat beer. Hoppy and flowery. Some sweetness, some bitterness. All in all, very nice.
(Za Popent 0,33l bottle)

Bottle at home, from BD Online, 12/07/14.
Lightly hazed pale golden blonde with a good sized off white covering.
Nose is bitter orange, tangerine, grass, light peach, juicy hops,
Taste comprises juicy hops, light floral, apricot, orange pith, light pine, raspberry jam, straw.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying hop infused close.
Solid stuff, nice thirst quencher on a hot summers evening.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Appearance: Hazy pale golden color with a thick white head. Good lacing.Aroma: Flower power hoppy and fruity.Palate: Medium (+) body. Tad sweet, and a fresh bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: Grapefruit hoppy. Balanced fruity, flowerpower and a mild malty back.Overall impression: To Øl still impress me, but that has maybe something to do with my love for hops. They tend to blend everything with a lot of hops, so the it is more and apa than a wheat ale.Personal stats: Bottle at Førtito Bar & Bowling in Sarpsborg, Norway.
White color-almost wit type. Hoppy and floral aromas. Citrus, hops and lots of lemon. Refreshing and bitter. Nice one.
Dunkel lys gyllen farve med lyst skum. Lukt av sitrus, humle og blomstereng. Smak av malt, honning, sitrus og grapefrukt. Melkebaren.
God noe søtlig duft av hvete. Fin litt dunkel gyllen farge. Tynn hinne hvitt skum, noe heng langs kant. Frisk noe søtlig smak av hvete.

On tap at The Evening Star, Brighton. Clouded gold with white head. Full and fruity beer, really quite hoppy, there is a zesty grapefruit along with lemon and a hint of pineapple. Finishes with a drying bitterness. Very good.

On tap at The Local Pub, Athens Greece. Poured a golden yellow color, hazy, with a white head. Aromas of flowers and citrus. Tastes like a fruit salad, or like a nice marmelade. orange, lemon, grapefruit, flowers. Medium aftertaste, not so long. Meium body with low to medium carbonation.
Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. This is a cloudy pale yellow coloured with a thin creamy head. It has a strong sweet lemon and tart citrus flavour, vanilla and spices on the creamy finish.

Bona cervesa, bastant equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, bastante equilibrada y sabrosa.

0,33 l bottle. BB 13. Feb 2017 From Biervana Munich 
hay, cereal, banana, citrus, herbs, floral, golden, cloudy, rocky head, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, lively,

Keg @Cimmeria, Oviedo.20-06-2014.
In short: a refreshing flower power ale.
Pours quite hazy golden, with nice frothy white head. Moderate to long head retention, good lacing. Citrusy, pine and flower explosion aromas, really aromatic. Medium body, average carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is a bit watery, but plenty of flavours from citrus to resins along with some sweet and flower ones, roses. Well integrated ingredients, not overwhelming nor saturating one, despite the lots of stuff in it. Enjoyable.
On tap at Biercab. Golden colour with white head. Floral, citric aroma. Wheat, floral, citric and bitter taste. Medium body.
Tap at Canalhouse, Nottingham. Cloudy, pale amber. Sticky, white head. Wheat. Sherbet. Lemon pith. Taste is light bitter. Some spicy dryness. Finish is dry and light bitter.

Niesamowicie pachnace kwiatami piwo. Laka maki oraz wiosenna polana. Takie mysli sie nasuwaja. W smaku ananas i arbuz oraz owoce cytrusowe. Wszystko cudnie pachnie kwiatami, bzem, hibiscusem oraz kobiecymi perfumami. Piwo niby delikatne ale ekstrakty zapachowe niektorych moga przytlaczac.
33cl bottle at Cerveteca Lisboa, Portugal. Gold color. Medium head. Medium body. Aroma is hop, floral, wheat and citric.
Drinking this after a spicy Chinese meal, and its perfect. Floral hoppy aroma, low level carbonation, full of flavour and a good bitter hop finish. Perfect .

I can actually smell this and it smells good! citrus, golden, amber, clear, sparkling, frothy, white foam, head remains, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, tastes awesome like grapefruit thanks Simon for the recommendation ;) light body, thin feel, slick feel, lively, astringent, my first tool beer but also my first Danish bar Carlsberg. Bottle at bottle shop Canterbury.

Keg at the bottle shop bermondsey. Aroma is really nice floral, pollen, honeysuckle and lemon. Translucent orange coloured pour with a lasting sticky white head and plenty of lace. Flavour is crisp lemon, doughy bread. Touch of acid on the tongue. Nice citrus floral finish with assertive slightly harsh bitterness. Cracking beer.

Look is hazy soft gold . Head small, stays quite long. Carbonisation is medium. Smells sweet fruit. Body light. Taste is not so fruit as the smell. Aftertaste long and bitter. Very strange beer in the good way.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2015 Bottle @ BrewDog Manchester. Aroma of lots of citra hoppiness. Some spring grassiness about it as well. Hazy golden amber with tiny lasting head. Taste is floral, light to moderate bitterness. Light sweetness. Finish is sweet. Texture is oily with light carbonation.

33 cl bottle @ hotel room, Copenhagen.
Pours hazy pale golden color with a large head. Aroma of citric fruits, wheat, some hay and mild herbal notes. Flavor of hay, wheat, citric fruits and yeast. Nice and refreshing brew.
3535

33 cl bottle @ hotel room, Copenhagen
Aroma is fruity with bubblegum and fruit candy. Flavour is fruity and hoppy with pineapple juice, some passionfruit and peaches. Sweet but nice.

0,33L bottle, BB 13.02.2017. Pours hazy golden with white head. The head stays. Aroma is fruity, floral, sour, and yeast. Taste is very hoppy fruity bitter, sweetness, orange, floral, malt, and some wheat in the background. Finish is nice fruity bitter. Overall: nice hoppy brew.
Sample from bottle at Beer14. Pours slightly hazy golden to orange, with a white head. Hoppy and fruity aroma with tropical fruits, pine and some floral notes. Well balanced and quite delicious!

On bottle at Beer14. Golden color, good foam. Good fruity & floral aromas, hops, citrus, orange. Medium body & complexity . Good bitterness & balance. Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured a hazy medium amber with a frothy off white head. Aroma of zesty citrus and soft malt. Medium to full body, flavour of mango and papaya, bitter finish.

Vycap Richtar Jakub. Zlata farba s bielou hustou penou. Vona ovocna, mandarinky, cerveny pomaranc, grapefruit. Chutovo uzasne. Hutne telo, ktore zabezpecovalo vyborny pocit v ustach. V chuti opat ovocne tony mandariniek, grapefruitov, jemne vanilka alebo nieco podobne. Pivo ma velmi prekvapilo. Uzasne.

Bottle. Teku glass. Orange with big, white, long-lasting white head with medium lacing. Hazy clarity. Low grainy and malty character, moderate to high mainly citrus hops aroma, but also some floral and pine notes. Slightly crispy character. Low to moderate hop bitterness, which appears in the middle and last into the finish. Floral hop flavours are more noticable than the floral aroma, also of course citrus hop flavours. Medium dry. Light to medium body, high carbonation. You can feel some alcohol warmth. Finish is rather malty and sweet. In overall very refreshing, hoppy beer.

From tap at Richtar Jakub. Hazy yellow color with creamy white head. Flowers, citrus in aroma. Well balanced sweetness with bitterness which arrives in the middle and gets stronger towards finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle, from the Norwegian importer. ABV is 6.3%. Hazy pinkish-yellow colour, large white head. Lovely aroma of fruity hops and flowers. Moderate fruity hops in the flavour too, followed by unusual floral and herbal notes. Low bitterness. Interesting, and quite good.

Handbottled from Richtar Jakub. Orange golden color with white head. Malt, tropical fruit, oranges, tangerines, grapefruit, grapefruit zest. Taste, solid malty base followed with nice portion of floral hops, oranges, tangerines, grapefruit zest, elderberry flowers. Nice.

Tap at RJ. Aroma is floral, elderberry, inviting. Tropical fruits. Hazy yellow colour. Taste is very well balanced, bitter with complementary elderberry flowery sourness. Tangerine, zesty. Thin bodied, short finish. Very good.
On tap. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma is strongly hoppy, fruity, grapefruit. Taste is bitter, hoppy, grapefruit, orange. Nice long hoppy finish.
Bottle. Hazy yellow/orange with a large frothy off white head. Citrus, pine, flowers, dry grass, dough. Medium body, medium sweet and bitter, oily texture, medium carbonation. Very drinkable.

Bottle from The Beerhive. Hazy golden body with a huge white head. Light carbonation. Great lacing. Aroma of citrus, green tea and grass. Flavour of grapefruit, orange, lemon and biscuit. Medium body with a watery, slightly oily texture. Soft fizz. Zippy and refreshing. Very nice.

Pours semi-clear yellow with a very large, quickly settling white head. Aroma is peach, honey, elderflower, rose petals, grass. Taste is honey, peach, elderflower, grass, grapefruit. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with quite high carbonation. Aftertaste is flowery with some elderflower. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330ml bottle from Valhallas Goat. Orange amber, good head. Resin hop aroma. Biscuit tropical fruit hop flavour. Bitter hop aftertaste. More an American Pale Ale than a wheat ale.

0,33 l bottle brought home from Kihosk, København. Firm fingerthick white head. Lightly hazed golden orange body. Inviting fruity hop aroma from the US hops added. Also some pretty nice leafy, herbal and floral notes. Body is light to medium full. Smooth and slick on the palate. Dry and subtle wheat flavor. Prominent fruity bitterness. Short wheaty fruity-bitter finish. Enjoyable.

330 ml bottle bought at Craftissimo in Tsim Sha Tsui East.
Looks: Cloudy hazy golden honey colour with scraps of yeast sediments; One and half finger head with crumpety white foam which lasts for 2 minutes; Good sticky lacing with very slight carbonation. 

Aroma: Very fragrant sweet ale malt, with fresh grapefruit, passion fruit, jackfruit, honey, flower petals, molasses, orange zest, yeast, light lime and grass.

Taste: Pleasant medium sweet ale malt, with fresh grapefruit, light passion fruit, floral, faint of mango, molasses, resin, light earth and spices, yeast, dry biscuits, strong liquorices, lime and sharp grass.

Body: Close to medium with quite oozy palate.

Mouth Feel: Full on fruity floral hops and flowery attacks, on tiop of a very dry crisp wheaty base. The fruity taste somehow not as intense as the aroma, but still very earthy and oozy. The assorted floral tastes are blurred within the hops.

Hoppiness: Refreshing fruity and light nose, earthy oozy and fruity taste. Liquorices are potent plus sharp grass lead to lasting, really astringent finish.

After Taste: Dry and crisp. Hoppy and bitter to mouth.

Comments: Compare to Mikkeller, I tend to believe To Øl for better brews. This one threw in the kitchen sink and all that, and the result is pretty damn close to the target - very fragrant and refreshing fruity aroma, earthy and oozy palate, rich and crisp at the same time, and really hoppy - its only drawback is the somewhat low-fi fruity and flowery taste. If these are fixed itll blow your mind away. At this level, its still a good one to enjoy, only couple steps away to perfection. Enjoyable!

Tap @Pudel, Tallinn
Hazy orange color, good white head. Resiny, woody hoppyness in the nose. Light to medium bodied. Fruity, resiny hoppyness dominates. Nice balance between bitterness and maltyness.

Bottle from a friend. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is floral, yeasty, malty, some grass and orange. Taste is moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Medium body with soft carbonation. Good wheat ale.

8th October 2013hazy amber beer with a good pale cream coloured head. Palate is soft with fine minerally carbonation. Nice orange and tangerine peel hops. Trace of lemon. Nice floral touch - sweet and bitter. Not getting the floral complexity I was expecting. Smooth finish. Very nice.

@ Bmd på Gastro med To Øl, det här var en torr men skönt balanserad sak med en liten kropp. Smaken bar toner av citrus och fläder och för at delge lite onödig information så passade den finfint till förätten som bestod av knivmussla och marulk.
Rätt mjuk i aroman. Lite smörig och blommig kanske. Väldigt mild. Passade fint till maten

33cl bottle at allmyvinyls homebrew gathering. Distinctly floral on the nose and taste. Almost perfumed. Its hard to tell that the base beer is wheat but wed probably notice if it wasnt there. Enjoyed this a lot.

330ml bottle from Brewdog Online Shop. Pours cloudy orange-yellow with a thin white head. Lovely floral aroma, as youd expect from something stuffed with flowers. It doesnt quite come together for me on the taste though, a bit all over the place, and nothing like a wheat beer, US or otherwise. Touch of funk if anything.

33cl bottle. It pours a deep golden peach colour with a large white head. Aroma is hoppy with wheat and plums. Taste is quite bitter and hoppy with some wheat and rose hip notes. Medium mouthfeel with good carboantion. Overall, good beer but doesnt really deliver the witbier + hibiscus as advertised.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours cloudy golden with a white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour is floral, fruit, and wheat  with a dry finish.
Bottle. Pale yellow with white head. Aroma of cereal, floral, orange. Taste of cereal, yeast amd orange. Refreshing and clean.
bottle at home ... light amber ... bubbly white head .. soft light dry ...soft floral ... dry zezt ... light foral ...little too dry and light for me

Bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen. Clear golden beer with a rich airy head. Floral aroma, citrus, lemongrass, roses, biscuits, herbal notes. Floral flavor, lemongrass, herbal, biscuits, lime, wheat notes, some spices. Hoppy floral finish with spicy notes.

Draught at WilliamK Annankatu. Thick orange color, white head. Bitter taste with grapefruit, floral hops, wheat, earthy notes, peach and a bit of pine. Bitter finish with grapefruit and hops. Excellent hoppy wheat.

Appearance is hazy orange. Leaves a lot of lacing. Tropical fruits, flowery notes and grape. Taste is really refreshing, wheat and dry hop flavors. At the end there is flowery and citrus hops. Nice carbonation. Refreshing and different.

Draught. Pours hazy dark orange in color with a foamy whitish head. Fruity garden notes, some floral notes as well. Just like taking a stroll through a summer meadow actually. Very nice and fresh at the same time. Some grassy bitterness together with fruity citrus in taste. Good, even if the soapy notes gets to you towards the end, yet this is easily one of the better wheat ales Ive tried.-- bb/wp
Tap. Slightly hazy deep golden color with a creamy white head. Aroma of fruity hops and grain. Flavors are bread, malt and peach. Bitter taste.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, CopenhagenMuddy golden color with creamy head. Delicate flowery aroma, jasmine tea. Smooth mouthfeel; moderate malt flavor, with a light mix of yeast spices, flowers, hop fruitiness.Not very clean, but quite nice.

Very subtle beautiful beer. Aroma of citric hops but also roses and delicate flowery notes. Taste is balanced in a mild sweet bitter way with enough room for the flowers. Delicate medium bodied yellow clear beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Yellow light orangy, hazy. Very strong grapefruity, slight peachy vanilla, hoppy nose, with a bit of yeastyness and a cream corny maltyness. Soft body, mouthfilling. A bit of hoppy greenery in the milky finsh. Nice hopbomb wheat ale.-- bb/wp8

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours golden orange with a short, fluffy white head and thin lacing. Upfront aroma of apricots, oranges, tropical fruits and banana. Combination of huge tropical flavours like passionfruit, orange, mango backed by the wheaty yeast profile. Hefty bitterness when you have a big swig, almost like a big IPA! Great approach for a wheat beer, these guys are killing it.

(Draught at Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen, 12 July 2013) Golden amber colour, slightly hazy, with frothy white head. Fruity, malty nose with notes of peaches, orange, tropical fruit and flowers. Malty, fruity taste with peaches, orange, tropical fruit and generous amounts of floral hops in the finish. Medium body, with a touch of sweetness. Quite tasty. Very nice.

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Medium sized slowly changing sticky white foamy head on top of a hazy darker yellow to orange colored beer.
Aromas of hop fruits, peach, some mango, flowers, malts, plants and floral tones.
Flavours of bitters, fruits, apricot, mango and blood orange, floral, flowers, hops, herbs, some malts, yeast, light dry and some light plant ish tones.
Aftertaste is bitter, floral, hoppy and fruity.
Low carbo, soft creamy mouthfeel, medium body and a thicker creamy texture.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Draught @ Kaisla, Helsinki. Pours a cloudy bright golden colour with a foamy head. Aroma of wheat, strong US hops (especially Amarillo) and weak sweet notes. Flavour of sweet caramel, Amarillo hops, grapefruit, yeast, grapefruit and apricot. Medium bodied, rich mouthfeel and a rich, floral, grassy, bitter finish. Refreshing with good drinkability. Great.

Tap. Yellow-brown and foggy. Thin white foam. Aroma is very piny and has some grapefruit. 

Taste has a strong hoppy bite right from the start. Full body. Bitter, long and smooth aftertaste. Low carbonation is a good fit here. Nice tasty brew.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends [ We are Opening A New Bar In Copenhagen Event ], Stefansgade 35, DK-2200 Copenhagen N, Denmark.Unclear medium orange colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, wheat - yeast, moderate to light heavy hoppy, herbs, orange - citrus. Flavour is moderate sweet and moderate to light light heavy bitter with a long to average duration, orange, zest, yeast. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20130316]
Keg @ common mcr heavy hoppy pale ale aroma taste is wheat lemongrass and long citrus notes. Stellar brew

Draught @Milenka, Helsinki. Poured murky orange color with a white head. Floral, fruity on the nose with some berries as well. Strawberries, citrus and floral notes in flavor. Quite musty and with a sweetish finish. DId not feel that fresh.
Tap at Kaisla, Helsinki. Colour is clear orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, wheat, hops and malts.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2013 Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours hazy orange with a small, dense white head leaving great lacing. Nose shows heavy floral and citrus driven hops with light wheat and spice. Touch of banana as it warms. A very hoppy take on a wheat style and I like it a lot. Very smooth, easy going stuff. Great hop focus gives it lengthy and quaffable bitterness. Nice
Tap @Kuikka. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma: Fruity and floral hops. Mild notes of wheat. Taste: Medium sweet, mild bitter. Palate: Medium body. Pretty good.

Tap at Mikkeller & Friends. Hazy golden with a dense white head, slowly diminishing. Fruity. Sevilla-orange marmelade accents. Wheaty. Light yeast. Creamy, smooth. Sex. Nice hoppy bitterness. The dried flowers are very distant, but a nice brew none the less.

Pours murky amber with a finger of white head. Aroma of grass, flowers, grapefruit, light pine. Taste is big fruit sweet with distinct bitterness turning into a lingering mellow bitter finish. Light body with soft carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(Keg at Kuikka, 20130618) The beer poured orange and cloudy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had fruitiness, citricness, orange peel and mildly malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, malts, white bread and bitterness. Aftertaste was musty and bitterness. The aroma was very good but the taste was a disappointment.
33 cl bottle from the hopduvel in Ghent.      Hazy light orange/ yellow body with a large white head. Very fruity citrus nose. Tastes idem with a nice bitter finish. Nice ipa *****

Very good, dense, lightly yellowish tinted head over veiled bright orange beer. Very aromatic, fruity, but also very catty hops! Ureum, dry hopbales, valerian. Again quite catty flavour, ureum, hayish. Bit resiny-metallic in the very finish; less fruity than the nose suggested. Wheat is far from obvious. Tad sharpish MF; feels very carbonated and yet slick (grist, wheat,...) Oh, quite OK after all.

Pours amber with a lasting, large head.
Nose shows fruity and piny hops along with subtle floral notes. Little else.
Light flavours of peach, pear, honey and pine. An assertive bitterness in the finish.
Could use more carbonation.

Draught @ Kuikka, Helsinki

Pours dark yellowish orange with a smooth foamy head. Aroma of fruity and floral hops, some spices and yeasty notes. Taste is stingy hoppy, floral and fruity with notes of wheat, spices and yeast. Finish is hoppy, floral and fruity. Quite nicely hopped wheat ale. Refreshing and tasty.

Slowbeer on tap (6-Jun-13) - Sweet fruity hop malt floral aroma. Light cloudy amber colour, decent head and ringed suds lacing. Big fruit peach floral hop flavour. Bitter floral spice hop finish and fruit floral aftertaste.

Bouteille 33cl, BB 19-02-2016. Enfin, déguster une bière légère dehors après avoir tondu la pelouse et célébrer le retour du soleil. Bref.
Couleur dorée-paille, col est généreux, épais et blanc-cassé.
Arôme est herbacé, citronné, malt et grains avec un très beau bouquet de houblons frais. Rappel lherbe fraîchement fauchée. Le côté fleuri reste modéré en comparaison au palais.
Ce dernier présente un profil généreux de froment, crisp avec des notes de malts pâles-pils. Lajout de pétales et feuilles donne une belle rondeur en bouche. Je note plus particulièrement lhibiscus et le pétale de rose. Agrume rajoute une légère amertume avec des notes de pamplemousse. En général, cette bière reste facile à boire avec des malts de bases parfait pour une blonde.
Not sure how well the plan hangs together. Floral early but the hops do a good job of dominating. Spice and metal shavings to finish.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a medium white head. A great mix of hops and flowers hit your nose. In the flavor a great bitterness and roses. Great flowery and citrussy finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Oro buona schiuma piuttosto persistente lieve agrumato citrico floreale discreto amaro quasi speziata buona secchezza

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2014 330ml bottle (Drink Shop, Tallinn) (7:3:7:4:14=3.5)
Lovely fruity fresh floral crisp aroma - indeed, spring is here. Pale hazy orange, brief small head. Taste follows the aroma closely, some more grassiness and fattiness from hops. Palate as crisp as youd hope for, and the 6.3% is nowhere to be seen - I can believe people would session this. Nice long bitterness, but of dry resininess. Some slightly soapy aspects to the floral finish. All round good golden-ale, not saying so wheaty to me.
Rerate: Tap (Pudel Baar, Tallinn) (7:4:7:4:15=3.7)
Very similar to the bottle. Head more persistent, more viscous  Plenty of lacing. Got to bump the score up - I like the look. Still just as delicious - has the balance between assertive hops and massive drinkability absolutely right. The rush of flavours the instant after you swallow is beautiful - uplifting, and even revitalising at 1:30am. Great beer.
Rerate: Tap (Toits, Tallinn) (7:4:6:3:12=3.2)
Lovely light floral aroma, rose. Nice hazy pale orange, small tight head. Stickier and stodgier palate than before not so refreshing. Too sweet. Shame. Not going to drop the recorded score as this is just one out of three.

Small bottle. Cloudy yellow body with a tall head. Aroma has tropical hops and fruits. Light and crisp taste, lots of hops. Finish has some fruitiness mixing with the hoppiness. The hop profile is very Danish (similar to Mikkeller). Good summer beer.
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a white head. Has a fruity floral hoppy spicy aroma. Fruity wheat malty floral hoppy citrus flavor. Has a fruity wheat malty floral hoppy citrus finish.

Bottle, bought @ Kihoskh, Cph. Pours hazy orange with a large, staying, creamy, white head. Aroma has citrus, peach, grapefruit, apricot. Medium carbonation, fine dry and light grainy mouthfeel. Flavour has fine wheat, light sweetness, citrus hops, light piney, grapefruit. Lingering bitterness. Good.
330ml bottle. Hazy orange color. Medium size white head, stays. Good lacing. Not much of the aroma. But citrus hops, mango, malty aroma. Slightly metallic, rotten watermelon, malty, hoppy flavor.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2017 0,33 bottle @ Il Pretesto. Pours golden murky with medium soft head.Sweet fruity aroma, citra hops...  strong hop bitter taste, very fresh, some tartness and wheat malt in the final.

Hazy yellow, white head. Nose is hoppy, tropical fruit, citrus, malt, sweet hints. Taste begins fruity, malty, somewhat sweet, and ends pretty hoppy, somewhat dry, grapefruity and bitter resiny with wheat hints. Medium body, weak but prickly carbonation, dry palate. Nice.
Bottle at home. Hazy orange color, smooth white head. Aroma of flowers, hops, malts. Hoppy taste, flowers, leafs, wheat. Dry finish.
UPDATED: SEP 26, 2015 Sample on tap. Aroma is malt, yeast, wheat, floral and a little citrus and other fruit. Flavour is malt, some saffron, fruit, hops, flowers, grapefruit and citrus.

Bottle 33 cl. Hazy golden with a huge and dense off-white head. Subtle fruity nose, quite yeasty. Light body, subtle flowery accents, again yeasty. Ends rather bitter. Lots of good intentions, but doesnt come out all that interesting. 250413

Nice looking bottle. Pours a light orange. Medium sized head. Aroma is of hops and a bit of yeast. Taste at first is a bit bland, but the finish is nice with taste of rose and other aromatic flowers. Refreshing.
A nice Spring/Summer beer.

Draught. Hazy light orange liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of lemon peel, flowers, citrus, pine, grass, biscuit, grain and mango. Taste is dry and light to medium bitter with notes of grain, lemon peel, citrus and pine. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. All right.

Draught at Bishops Arms Folkungagatan, Stockholm.  Cloudy golden, small head. Fruity perfumey floral nose. Mid sweet with clean rounded mouthfeel and medium body. Wheat bread, pears and slight perfume. Mid bitter finish. Pleasant, but not with much depth.

Draught at Jerntorgets Brygghus, Göteborg, on April 7, 2013.Hazy apricot color, off-white head. Fruity, citrus, hoppy, mango, tropical fruits taste, fresh. Medium mouthfeel, medium high bitterness. Fresh, hoppy, citrus scent.
Hazy golden body, foamy persistent white head. Fruity and floreal aroma. Taste is citrus-bitter. Bitter finish. A bit watery, soft carbonation

05-APR-2013, bottle @home, from Ølbutikken. 
Hazy yellow with lasting white head. 
Aroma has no weat character at all. Very hoppy with petrol, grape fruit and pine. Taste the same.  Medium body and lively carbonation.
Fat på Bishop Gustav. Frisk och fruktig med mycket humle, smak av tropisk frukt, blommig. Välbalanserad med en sträv citrusbeska med inslag av granskott.

Fat på Bishop Gustav. Fantstiskt fruktig doft av passionsfrukt, ananas, söt citrus med blommiga övertoner. Smaken är fruktig, frisk, lätt, ren, krispig. Fina fruktiga smaker av tropisk frukter, nektar, torrare avslutning med lätt citrusbeska. Ett våröl att njuta i solen. Fantastiskt gott.

Tap @ Mikkeller, Stefansgade. Hazy yellow with white head. Aroma is malt, yeast, wheat, hop, little floral and a little citrus. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, little grapefruit, little citrus, little earthy and medium bitter.
33cl, new exclusive Danish brew Anno 2013, with flowers, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex bitter brew, floral/bitter and slightly fruity/woody, balanced, hazy, good head, good brew, yet expensive
Oklar koppar-orange med fast vitt skum. Doft: Humle, jord, hallon, barr. Smak: Frukt sallad, trä, gräs, jord.

Bottled. Dark Golden coloured. Unclear. Dense Light beige head. Aroma. Flowers, grapefruit, sweetness, syrup. Flavour. Herbs, flowers, citrus, vague caramel. Medium to full bodied. Ends fcrispy and flowery bitter in the end.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden  with a lasting and good lacing frothy big white head. Aroma is perfumy, flowery, peach, grapefruit, lime, citrus and pine. Taste is near medium sweet and medium bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily/creamy/fluffy, carbonation is moderate. Finishes dry with exotic fruity hops. Quite hoppy and the body is quite nice.

Tap @ Mikkeller, Stefansgade. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and rather hoppy - peach and grapefruit. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 160313
Chopp. Hazy deep golden colour, small white head. Pleasant yeasty exotic fruity hoppy piney aroma. Good mouthfeel. Sweet like pleasantly exotic fruity hoppy piney flavour. Good bitterness.
Draft. A hazy yellow beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of malt, hops, peaches, and flowers. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, straw, flowers, and peaches.
Draught at Mikkeller & Friends preOpening. Cloudy yellow - white head. Fresh hoppy. Flowery. Yeasty. Wheaty. Grape fruits. Peachy notes. Fruity. Piney notes. Nice bitterness.
From tap at Mikkeller & Friends. Pours cloudy yellow with a white head. Fruity aroma. Grapefruity and peachy. Bitter and crisp hippy. Lingering citrusy. Bitter and grapefruity. Dry hoppy finish.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar Stefansgade.
Hazy amber coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hops and pine needles.
Fruity flavour of citrus peel, hops and pine needles.
Dry hoppy finish.
